# incrcovariancematrix

> Compute an [unbiased sample covariance matrix][covariance-matrix] incrementally.

<section class="usage">

## Usage

```javascript
var incrcovariancematrix = require( '@stdlib/stats/incr/covariance-matrix' );
```

#### incrcovariancematrix( out\[, means] )

Returns an accumulator `function` which incrementally computes an [unbiased sample covariance matrix][covariance-matrix].

```javascript
// Create an accumulator for computing a 2-dimensional covariance matrix:
var accumulator = incrcovariancematrix( 2 );
```

An `out` argument may be either the number of dimensions or an output [`ndarray`][@stdlib/ndarray/ctor] for storing the [unbiased sample covariance matrix][covariance-matrix].

```javascript
var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
var ctor = require( '@stdlib/ndarray/ctor' );

var matrix = ctor( 'float64', 2 );

var buffer = new Float64Array( 4 );
var shape = [ 2, 2 ];
var strides = [ 2, 1 ];

// Create a 2-dimensional output covariance matrix:
var cov = matrix( buffer, shape, strides, 0, 'row-major' );

var accumulator = incrcovariancematrix( cov );
```

When means are known, the function supports providing a 1-dimensional [`ndarray`][@stdlib/ndarray/ctor] containing mean values.

```javascript
var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
var ctor = require( '@stdlib/ndarray/ctor' );

var vector = ctor( 'float64', 1 );
var buffer = new Float64Array( 2 );
var shape = [ 2 ];
var strides = [ 1 ];

var means = vector( buffer, shape, strides, 0, 'row-major' );

means.set( 0, 3.0 );
means.set( 1, -5.5 );

var accumulator = incrcovariancematrix( 2, means );
```

#### accumulator( \[vector] )

If provided a data vector, the accumulator function returns an updated [unbiased sample covariance matrix][covariance-matrix]. If not provided a data vector, the accumulator function returns the current [unbiased sample covariance matrix][covariance-matrix].

```javascript
var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
var ctor = require( '@stdlib/ndarray/ctor' );

var vector = ctor( 'float64', 1 );
var buffer = new Float64Array( 2 );
var shape = [ 2 ];
var strides = [ 1 ];

var vec = vector( buffer, shape, strides, 0, 'row-major' );

var accumulator = incrcovariancematrix( 2 );

vec.set( 0, 2.0 );
vec.set( 1, 1.0 );

var out = accumulator( vec );
// returns <ndarray>

var bool = ( out === cov );
// returns true

vec.set( 0, 1.0 );
vec.set( 1, -5.0 );

out = accumulator( vec );
// returns <ndarray>

vec.set( 0, 3.0 );
vec.set( 1, 3.14 );

out = accumulator( vec );
// returns <ndarray>

out = accumulator();
// returns <ndarray>
```

</section>

<section class="examples">

## Examples

<!-- eslint no-undef: "error" -->

```javascript
var randu = require( '@stdlib/random/base/randu' );
var ctor = require( '@stdlib/ndarray/ctor' );
var Float64Array = require( '@stdlib/array/float64' );
var incrcovariancematrix = require( '@stdlib/stats/incr/covariance-matrix' );

var cov;
var cxy;
var cyx;
var vx;
var vy;
var i;

// Initialize an accumulator for a 2-dimensional covariance matrix:
var accumulator = incrcovariancematrix( 2 );

// Create a 1-dimensional data vector:
var vector = ctor( 'float64', 1 );

var buffer = new Float64Array( 2 );
var shape = [ 2 ];
var strides = [ 1 ];

var vec = vector( buffer, shape, strides, 0, 'row-major' );

// For each simulated data vector, update the unbiased sample covariance matrix...
for ( i = 0; i < 100; i++ ) {
    vec.set( 0, randu()*100.0 );
    vec.set( 1, randu()*100.0 );
    cov = accumulator( vec );

    vx = cov.get( 0, 0 ).toFixed( 4 );
    vy = cov.get( 1, 1 ).toFixed( 4 );
    cxy = cov.get( 0, 1 ).toFixed( 4 );
    cyx = cov.get( 1, 0 ).toFixed( 4 );

    console.log( '[ %d, %d\n  %d, %d ]', vx, cxy, cyx, vy );
}
```

</section>
